bill.title: Relative to the acquisition, sale, or demolition of municipal land or buildings.
bill.description: Relative to the acquisition, sale, or demolition of municipal land or buildings.

history.action: Introduced (in recess of) 01/06/2021 and referred to Municipal and County Government House Journal  2 P. 37

bill.full_text: selectmen demolition of buildings amend the section heading of rsa to read as follows acquisition or sale of land buildings or both demolition or disposal of buildings selectmen demolition of land or buildings amend rsa i to read as follows if adopted in accordance with rsa the selectmen select board shall have the authority to acquire or sell land buildings or both and to demolish or otherwise dispose of buildings provided however they shall first submit any such proposed acquisition or sale demolition or disposal to the planning board and to the conservation commission the heritage commission and the historic district commission if the building lies within a defined district for review and recommendation by those bodies where such board or commission or both commissions exist after the selectmen receive select board receives the recommendation of the planning board and the conservation commission the heritage commission and the historic district commission if the building lies within a defined district where such board or commission or both commissions exist they shall hold public hearings at least but not more than days apart on the proposed acquisition or sale demolition or disposal provided however upon the written petition of registered voters presented to the selectmen select board prior to the selectmen s select board s vote according to the provisions of rsa the proposed acquisition or sale demolition or disposal shall be inserted as an article in the warrant for the town meeting the selectmen s select board s vote shall take place no sooner then days nor later than days after the second public hearing which is held new paragraph demolition or disposal of municipal buildings amend rsa by inserting after paragraph ii the following new paragraph the provisions of this section shall not apply to the demolition or disposal of and the selectmen shall have no authority to demolish or dispose of any real estate that has been given devised or bequeathed to the town for charitable or community purposes except as provided in rsa or rsa application this act shall be effective in all towns in which the provisions of rsa have previously been adopted and remain in effect without further action by the town
